output_handle_t()¶
template<class float_t>
output_handle_t(const std::string filetype, const std::string filename, const model_constants_t<float_t> &cc, const reference_quantities_t &ref_quant, const std::string in_filename, const uint32_t write_index, const uint32_t snapshot_index, const int &rank, const int &simulation_mode, const bool &initial_cond, const double delay_out_time = 0)¶
template<class float_t>
void setup(const std::string filetype, const std::string filename, const model_constants_t<float_t> &cc, const reference_quantities_t &ref_quant, const std::string in_filename, const uint32_t write_index, const uint32_t snapshot_index, const int &rank, const double delay_out_time = 0)¶
void reset(const uint32_t traj_id, const uint32_t ens_id, const uint64_t n_flushed = 0)¶

Reset the number of flushed and recorded snapshots and update the current trajectory and ensemble id. This function is needed for static scheduling.

Parameters

  • traj_id: New trajectory id for the output

  • ens_id: New ensemble id for the output

template<class float_t>
void buffer_gradient(const model_constants_t<float_t> &cc, const std::vector<std::array<double, num_par>> &y_diff, const uint32_t snapshot_index)¶

Buffer the gradients. If snapshot_index > 1, then the average gradient is saved.

Parameters

  • cc:

  • y_diff:

  • snpashot_index:

template<class float_t>
void buffer(const model_constants_t<float_t> &cc, const netcdf_reader_t &netcdf_reader, const std::vector<float_t> &y_single_new, const std::vector<std::array<double, num_par>> &y_diff, const uint32_t sub, const uint32_t t, const reference_quantities_t &ref_quant, const uint32_t snapshot_index)¶

Writes data either to a stringstream for txt files or to different vectors for netCDF files.

template<class float_t>
void flush_buffer(const model_constants_t<float_t> &cc, const bool no_flush = false)¶

Write the buffered data to disk or call certain functions for collective access of the data if needed.

Parameters

  • cc:

  • no_flush: If true: do not really flush anything and just call the flushing routines, which is needed if compression is enabled.

template<class float_t>
void process_step(const model_constants_t<float_t> &cc, const netcdf_reader_t &netcdf_reader, const std::vector<float_t> &y_single_new, const std::vector<std::array<double, num_par>> &y_diff, const uint32_t sub, const uint32_t t, const uint32_t write_index, const uint32_t snapshot_index, const bool last_step, const reference_quantities_t &ref_quant)¶

Buffer the current data (model state and gradients) and flush it to disk if necessary (depending on the time step.).

Parameters

  • cc:
